results.name: a(n) = image of n under the Kaprekar map n -> (n with digits sorted into descending order) - (n with digits sorted into ascending order).
comment: Entries are multiples of 9 - see A151950.
a(n) =  A004186(n) - A004185(n); a(A010785(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, corrected: Mar 23 2015, Jul 09 2013
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000 (terms 0..1000 from Joseph Myers and Robert G. Wilson v)

H. Hanslik, E. Hetmaniok, I. Sobstyl, et al., Orbits of the Kaprekar's transformations-some introductory facts, Zeszyty Naukowe Politechniki Śląskiej, Seria: Matematyka Stosowana z. 5, Nr kol. 1945; 2015.
R. J. Mathar, Maple code for A151949 and A151959
Joseph Myers, C program for computing sequences related to the Kaprekar map
Joseph Myers, List of cycles under Kaprekar map (all numbers with <= 60 digits; cycles are represented by their smallest value)
Index entries for the Kaprekar map
mathematica: f[n_] := Module[{idn = IntegerDigits@n, idns}, idns = Sort@ idn; FromDigits@ Reverse@ idns - FromDigits@ idns]; Table[ f@n, {n, 0, 200}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 18 2009 *)
Flatten[Table[Differences[FromDigits /@ {y = Sort[x = IntegerDigits[n]], Reverse[y]}], {n, 0, 74}]] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 11 2013 *)
xref: In other bases: A164884 (base 2), A164993 (base 3), A165012 (base 4), A165032 (base 5), A165051 (base 6), A165071 (base 7), A165090 (base 8), A165110 (base 9). - _Joseph Myers_, Sep 05 2009
